intro: Calispermum rude, commonly known as rough calispermum, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are deeply lobed and have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and often branched. Calispermum rude is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in partial shade to full sun conditions.
